reasoning: Bone hemangiomas are benign vascular tumors, most commonly found incidentally in vertebrae (80% of cases) or flat bones. Estimated incidence ~0.5 per 100k per year based on autopsy studies and imaging surveys showing prevalence of 10-12% in vertebral bodies. Most are asymptomatic and clinically insignificant.
source: Theodorou DJ et al. (2012). Hemangiomas of the spine. AJNR Am J Neuroradiol. 33:1586-95
